tiny.text: Mean water levels (setup + surge) CAT1 hurricane

medium.title: Mean water levels during a category 1 hurricane
medium.text: These data represent the storm-induced mean water levels at the shoreline for generalized category 1 hurricane conditions. Values were computed by summing modeled storm surge (NOAA SLOSH) and parameterized wave setup.

full.title: Mean water levels expected during a category 1 hurricane: National Assessment of Hurricane-Induced Coastal Erosion Hazards
full.text: These data represent the storm-induced mean water levels at the shoreline for generalized category 1 hurricane conditions. Values were computed by summing modeled storm surge (NOAA SLOSH) and parameterized wave setup. Data for mid-Atlantic states were updated using new lidar data collected in November 2012 following Hurricane Sandy. For additional information, please see publications listed on the USGS National Assessment of Hurricane-Induced Coastal Erosion Hazards website (http://coastal.er.usgs.gov/hurricanes/erosionhazards/).
